result.execSummary:
The defendant Kerry Lyn NIMMER was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Schedule II Narcotics (Morphine), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Deliver Schedule II Narcotics (Fentanyl), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

On Count 1, defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample.

Stipulation and Order for Substitution of Attorney.
It is hereby ordered that Brett Kaehne be substituted as attorney of record in this action.  Ann Larson is relieved of any furhter responsibility in this matter.

It is hereby ordered, the prior bond conditions in this case prohibiting the defendant from traveling outside the County of Manitowoc is removed.  All previous conditions of bond remain in full effect.  In addition, the defendant is prohibited from entering the Potawatomi Casino, may not be present on their business grounds or on the reservation.

MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL - 
The parties are requesting a condition of bail that the defendant have no contact with Potowanami Casino, the Potowanami Reservation or any grounds they occupy and requests that the condition of no travel outside Manitowoc County be removed.  Any other conditions would remain in effect.
The Court grants the motion and orders Attorney Kaehne to draft the order.

Order Modifying Bail. 
It is hereby ordered that the defendant's motion to modify bond to allow Kerry Nimmber to travel to Brown County for medical care and to Forest County to attend her court proceedings is hereby granted.  Further, Kerry Nimmer is allowed to stay at her husband's home in Oconto County on nights prior to her court hearings in Forest County if the hearing is scheduled to begin before 11:00 a.m.
Cover Letter

Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.   
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.   Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.   Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 04-02-15 at 4:00 p.m.   State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.   
BAIL MOTION
Counsel argue motion.  Court will modify defendant's bond to allow travel to Forest County for court appearances and to Brown County for medical purposes and she is allowed to stay with her husband in Oconto County the night before when she has court appearances before 11:00 a.m.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 6 counts deliver schedule II narcotics.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 01-26-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $500.00 cash with the conditions that have no controlled substances unless valid prescription from a doctor, that she maintain absolute sobriety and that she not travel outside of Manitowoc County unless approved by the court.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
